params.text: The preview displays a graphic representation of the dimension style and shows the effects of changes to the settings.

Sets the method for calculating the tolerance.
  • None: Does not add a tolerance.
  • Symmetrical: Adds a plus/minus expression of tolerance in which a single value of variation is applied to the dimension measurement. A plus-or-minus sign appears after the dimension. Enter the tolerance value in Upper Value.
  • Deviation: Adds a plus/minus tolerance expression. Different plus and minus values of variation are applied to the dimension measurement. A plus sign (+) precedes the tolerance value entered in Upper Value, and a minus sign (-) precedes the tolerance value entered in Lower Value.
  • Limits: Creates a limit dimension. A maximum and a minimum value are displayed, one over the other. The maximum value is the dimension value plus the value entered in Upper Value. The minimum value is the dimension value minus the value entered in Lower Value.
  • Basic: Creates a basic dimension, which displays a box around the full extents of the dimension. Basic dimensions are used in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing to describe the theoretically exact location, orientation, size, or profile of a feature or datum target. Because basic dimensions are theoretically perfect dimensions, there are no tolerances associated with them.
Sets the number of decimal places.
Sets the current height for the tolerance text as the ratio of the tolerance height to the main dimension text height.
Aligns the tolerance text with the top, middle or bottom of the main dimension text.
Controls the alignment of upper and lower tolerance values when stacked. Values are stacked by either their decimal or operation symbols.

backgroundImageAltText: AutoCAD Dimension Style Manager Tolerances tab items
